data.name: equipo_medico_1
data.value: We are associated by project with the leading brands of medical equipment for hospitals, clinics and doctors' offices

data.name: fuerza_productora_1
data.value:
We represent:
more than 5,000 beekeepers throughout Mexico and
We have an agreement with the 3 main packaging companies that meet the strictest export requirements, to be able to supply, from 350-gram jars to 300-kilogram barrels

data.name: la_miel_en_el_mundo_1
data.value:
Honey is a food, so it is regulated by specialized agencies around the world such as: The United States Food and Drug Administration or Food and Drug Administration, FDA, The Alimentarius Codex which is an initiative of the World Health Organization, WHO and The European Food Safety Authority or European Food Safety Authority, EFSA.
In Mexico, the regulatory authority is SENASICA, belonging to the Official Agricultural Organization and which homologates its principles and regulations to those of the FDA of its commercial partner.
Under these standards the FAO considers that, for honey, the five main honey producers are China, Russia, Mexico, the United States and Spain

data.name: la_miel_en_el_mundo_2
data.value:
The most appreciated honeys are those from Brazil, Spain and Mexico for their purity, medicinal properties and nutritional properties.
The National Library of Medicine of the United States registers 320 types of honey; and in Mexico there are more than 250 of them

data.name: maquinaria_1
data.value: We have associated with the best construction machinery lessors

data.name: miel_mexicana_multiflora_1
data.value:
It is the most sold in Mexico, the United States of America, and Asia, since the producing bees are MELIFERAS, which travel through many regions of the vast Mexican territory. Producing honey with a mixture of flavors and consistencies.
Mexican beekeepers homogenize it by creating a flavor standard known throughout the world for a sweet taste with a touch of acid that makes it exquisite.

data.name: miel_mexicana_uniflora_1
data.value: In Mexico there are endemic flowers that produce pollen that, when processed by the bee, create a sweet, semi-acid, semi-bitter honey

data.name: miel_mexicana_uniflora_2
data.value: Mexican endemic honeys are Mezquite, Tojonal, Avocado, Dzizilche, Jabín

data.name: miel_mexicana_uniflora_3
data.value:
The advantage of Mexican Honey, over other countries, is that it is harvested throughout the year due to its mild climate.
An example is ORANGE honey, whose honey is "small light amber drops" which is the sweet honey of other citrus fruits.
Its flavor is delicate and very floral, it is a type of honey that hardly crystallizes.
Its flavor combines perfectly with infusions and fruit desserts.

data.name: proceso_de_venta_paso2_1
data.value: Call our office in Mexico at +52 5547392178 from Monday to Friday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. for shipping information and delivery time and place the order

data.name: proceso_de_venta_paso3_1
data.value: Verified the amount, quantity and type of packaging, the invoice and the payment method will be sent to you

data.name: proceso_de_venta_paso4_1
data.value: Our transporter and / or exporter company will deliver it where you need it

data.name: productos_sustentables_1
data.value: We believe in sustainability as a mandatory part of in the industrial production, for this reason we commercialize any product with certificates of protection and benefit to nature
